member.name: T:Loogn.OrmLite.SqlHelper
member.summary: The SqlHelper class is intended to encapsulate high performance, scalable best practices for common uses of SqlClient

member.name: M:Loogn.OrmLite.SqlHelper.AttachParameters(System.Data.Common.DbCommand,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[])
member.summary:
This method is used to attach array of MySqlParameters to a MySqlCommand.
This method will assign a value of DbNull to any parameter with a direction of InputOutput and a value of null.
This behavior will prevent default values from being used, but this will be the less common case than an intended pure output parameter (derived as InputOutput) where the user provided no input value.
member.param: The command to which the parameters will be added
An array of MySqlParameters to be added to command

member.name: M:Loogn.OrmLite.SqlHelper.PrepareCommand(System.Data.Common.DbCommand,System.Data.Common.DbConnection,System.Data.Common.DbTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[],System.Boolean@)
member.summary: This method opens (if necessary) and assigns a connection, transaction, command type and parameters to the provided command
member.param: A valid MySqlConnection, on which to execute this command
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of MySqlParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required
true if the connection was opened by the method, otherwose is false.

member.name: M:Loogn.OrmLite.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.Data.Common.DbConnection,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a MySqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the specified MySqlConnection using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(conn, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders", new MySqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Loogn.OrmLite.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.Data.Common.DbTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a MySqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the specified MySqlTransaction using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(trans, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", new MySqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: T:Loogn.OrmLite.SqlHelper.MySqlConnectionOwnership
member.summary: This enum is used to indicate whether the connection was provided by the caller, or created by SqlHelper, so that we can set the appropriate CommandBehavior when calling ExecuteReader()

member.name: F:Loogn.OrmLite.SqlHelper.MySqlConnectionOwnership.Internal
member.summary: Connection is owned and managed by SqlHelper

member.name: F:Loogn.OrmLite.SqlHelper.MySqlConnectionOwnership.External
member.summary: Connection is owned and managed by the caller

member.name: M:Loogn.OrmLite.SqlHelper.ExecuteReader(System.Data.Common.DbConnection,System.Data.Common.DbTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[],Loogn.OrmLite.SqlHelper.MySqlConnectionOwnership)
member.summary: Create and prepare a MySqlCommand, and call ExecuteReader with the appropriate CommandBehavior.
member.remarks:
If we created and opened the connection, we want the connection to be closed when the DataReader is closed.
If the caller provided the connection, we want to leave it to them to manage.
member.param: A valid MySqlConnection, on which to execute this command
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of MySqlParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required
Indicates whether the connection parameter was provided by the caller, or created by SqlHelper
member.returns: MySqlDataReader containing the results of the command

member.name: M:Loogn.OrmLite.SqlHelper.ExecuteReader(System.Data.Common.DbConnection,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a MySqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the specified MySqlConnection using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: MySqlDataReader dr = ExecuteReader(conn, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", new MySqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: A MySqlDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:Loogn.OrmLite.SqlHelper.ExecuteReader(System.Data.Common.DbTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a MySqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the specified MySqlTransaction using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: MySqlDataReader dr = ExecuteReader(trans, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", new MySqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: A MySqlDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:Loogn.OrmLite.SqlHelper.ExecuteScalar(System.Data.Common.DbConnection,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a MySqlCommand (that returns a 1x1 resultset) against the specified MySqlConnection using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: int orderCount = (int)ExecuteScalar(conn, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrderCount", new MySqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: An object containing the value in the 1x1 resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:Loogn.OrmLite.SqlHelper.ExecuteScalar(System.Data.Common.DbTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a MySqlCommand (that returns a 1x1 resultset) against the specified MySqlTransaction using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: int orderCount = (int)ExecuteScalar(trans, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrderCount", new MySqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: An object containing the value in the 1x1 resultset generated by the command
